SENT.plain: A 2-year-old child fell on a toothbrush, sustaining a pharyngeal injury
Eighteen hours later, localizing symptoms of a cerebrovascular accident became evident
Magnetic resonance angiography showed occlusion of the internal carotid artery and a cerebral infarction
She was treated with anticoagulation and made a complete recovery
Pharyngeal injuries may be complicated by internal carotid artery thrombosis and embolus
Management includes prompt diagnosis, anticoagulation, and carotid artery exploration in selected cases
